---
toc_max_heading_level: 4
slug: /sidebar/items
---

# Sidebar items

The Docusaurus sidebar supports multiple item types that let you organize and present documentation in a flexible way.
Below are the supported **item types**:

* **[Doc](#sidebar-item-doc)**: Link to a single doc page and associate it with a sidebar.
* **[Link](#sidebar-item-link)**: Link to any internal or external page.
* **[Category](#sidebar-item-category)**: Create a dropdown of sidebar items.
* **[Autogenerated](autogenerated)**: Automatically generate a sidebar slice based on the file system.
* **[HTML](#sidebar-item-html)**: Render pure HTML in the sidebar.
* **[Ref](multiple-sidebars#sidebar-item-ref)**: Link to a doc page without participating in navigation generation.

<AdsComponent />

## Doc: link to a doc {#sidebar-item-doc}

The `doc` type links to a doc page and assigns that page to a sidebar.

```ts
type SidebarItemDoc =
  | {
      type: 'doc';
      id: string;
      label?: string;
      key?: string;
      className?: string;
      customProps?: Record<string, unknown>;
    }
  | string; // shorthand
```

Example:

```js title="sidebars.js"
export default {
  mySidebar: [
    {
      type: 'doc',
      id: 'getting-started',
      label: 'Getting Started',
    },
    // Shorthand syntax
    'introduction',
  ],
};
```

> **Tip:** Use `sidebar_label` or `sidebar_custom_props` in the doc’s front matter to override labels or add metadata.

<AdsComponent />

## Link: link to any page {#sidebar-item-link}

The `link` type links to **internal** or **external** pages.

```ts
type SidebarItemLink = {
  type: 'link';
  label: string;
  href: string;
  description?: string;
  key?: string;
  className?: string;
  customProps?: Record<string, unknown>;
};
```

Example:

```js title="sidebars.js"
export default {
  linksSidebar: [
    {
      type: 'link',
      label: 'Home',
      href: '/',
    },
    {
      type: 'link',
      label: 'GitHub',
      href: 'https://github.com',
    },
  ],
};
```

<AdsComponent />

## HTML: render custom markup {#sidebar-item-html}

The `html` type renders custom HTML inside a sidebar `<li>` element.

```ts
type SidebarItemHtml = {
  type: 'html';
  value: string;
  defaultStyle?: boolean;
  key?: string;
  className?: string;
  customProps?: Record<string, unknown>;
};
```

Example:

```js title="sidebars.js"
export default {
  myHtmlSidebar: [
    {
      type: 'html',
      value: '<strong>Core Concepts</strong>',
      defaultStyle: true,
    },
  ],
};
```

<AdsComponent />

## Category: create a hierarchy {#sidebar-item-category}

The `category` type groups related items and can be collapsible.

```ts
type SidebarItemCategory = {
  type: 'category';
  label: string;
  items: SidebarItem[];
  description?: string;
  key?: string;
  className?: string;
  customProps?: Record<string, unknown>;
  collapsible?: boolean;
  collapsed?: boolean;
  link?: SidebarItemCategoryLinkDoc | SidebarItemCategoryLinkGeneratedIndex;
};
```

Example:

```js title="sidebars.js"
export default {
  docs: [
    {
      type: 'category',
      label: 'Guides',
      collapsible: true,
      collapsed: false,
      items: [
        'creating-pages',
        {
          type: 'category',
          label: 'Advanced',
          items: ['versioning', 'i18n'],
        },
      ],
    },
  ],
};
```

### Category links

A category can link to:

* **Generated index page** – auto-creates an index listing all children.

```js
link: {
  type: 'generated-index',
  title: 'Docusaurus Guides',
  description: 'Overview of guides',
  slug: '/category/guides',
}
```

* **Doc link** – link to a specific document.

```js
link: { type: 'doc', id: 'introduction' }
```

<AdsComponent />

### Collapsible and expanded options

* `collapsible: false` → category is fixed open.
* `collapsed: false` → expanded by default.

Global defaults can be configured in `docusaurus.config.js`:

```js title="docusaurus.config.js"
export default {
  presets: [
    [
      '@docusaurus/preset-classic',
      {
        docs: {
          sidebarCollapsible: false,
          sidebarCollapsed: false,
        },
      },
    ],
  ],
};
```

---

## Using shorthands {#using-shorthands}

You can simplify definitions with **doc** and **category** shorthand.

### Doc shorthand

```js title="sidebars.js"
export default {
  sidebar: ['myDoc'],
};
```

### Category shorthand

```js title="sidebars.js"
export default {
  sidebar: {
    'Getting Started': ['intro', 'setup'],
    Guides: ['advanced'],
  },
};
```

This shorthand allows nested categories:

```js title="sidebars.js"
export default {
  sidebar: {
    Docusaurus: {
      Basics: ['intro', 'setup'],
      Advanced: ['versioning', 'plugins'],
    },
  },
};
```

---

These options make Docusaurus sidebars **flexible and powerful**, letting you mix links, docs, categories, and even custom HTML to create rich navigation experiences.
